summaries.novice: Learn the basic types of verbal behavior and how language is categorized by function.
summaries.standard: Differentiate between echoics, mands, tacts, intraverbals, and codics during teaching.
summaries.expert: Apply Skinner’s verbal behavior framework to develop functional communication across contexts.

sections.title: Overview of Verbal Behavior
sections.content: Verbal behavior is defined by its function and the environmental variables that control language.

sections.title: Echoic
sections.content: Echoics involve vocal imitation with point-to-point correspondence and formal similarity.

sections.title: Mand
sections.content: Mands are requests controlled by motivating operations and reinforced by getting what is requested.

sections.title: Tact
sections.content: Tacts label environmental stimuli and are reinforced by generalized reinforcers.

sections.title: Intraverbal & Codic
sections.content: Intraverbals support conversation; codics include reading and writing with correspondence but not formal similarity.
